body.name: APPS2Car for Garmin GPS Car Mount, Windshield Dashboard Suction Cup GPS Mount for Car, Replacement GPS Holder for Garmin Dezl Drive Zumo DriveSmart RV Nuvi Driveassist StreetPilot DriveLuxe

features: *Please Note *- This GPS ball mount is not compatible with RV 890; and Bracket Mount is not included

EXTRA LONG GOOSENECK ARM - The suction cup gps car mount for Garmin can bend up to 13.5 inches for various visual angles to your liking, making it easy to mount the GPS on the windshield or dashboard without blocking the field of view especially when you drive a truck, semi-truck even with a large dashboard

SUPER STICKY SUCTION CUP - Featuring a layer of super sticky gel and locking lever for steady hold, the for Garmin suction cup mount for truck will not come undone or slip off; You can effortlessly mount it on most flat surfaces, such as dashboard, table, wall, windshield, and window

ANTI-VIBRATION STABILIZER - With the extra hold of the anti-shake stabilizer, the strong sticky suction cup replacement ball mount can securely hold the GPS navigator in its position without vibrating around even on a bumpy road
REPLACEMENT GPS MOUNT - An alternative to gps cd slot mount holder, gps air vent mount holder, gps friction beanbag mount holder and gps dash pad (NB: Mounting bracket is not included)

WIDE COMPATIBILITY - Fit for Garmin Dezl 550 560 570 580 660 680 760 770 780 785 790(LM LMT LMT-S LMTHD), Drivesmart 50 51 60 61 70 71(LMT NA LMT-S LMTHD), Driveassist 50 51 60 61 (LMT LMT-S LMT-D LMTHD NA), NuviCam LMTHD, RV 660 760 770 (LMT LMT-S), Zumo 220 340 345 350 390 395 396 450 550 590 595 660 665 (LM LMT-S), DezlCam StreetPilot DriveLuxe Aera DriveRrack series, etc

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid product that was easy to adjust
reviews.reviewText: I was looking to add a GPS,even though I used Google maps like everyone else, I just couldn't stand the bad navigation and the new advertising popping up...lift anyone? While you're driving?So I got the Garmin with traffic.This extended stand allowed me to place the GPS within my arm length and right below the line of sight through the windshield.Straight forward install, although without the little support foot the unit would wobble quite a bit.The little foot confounded me a but,expecting a sticking attachment. I found that the tricky was to install the bar without the support, bend it so there is some tension to the target area where the support foot would be, then slide the foot in place.No more wobbling! YAY.I guess we'll find out if the main suction cup will hold during the summer. But as it is it is holding tight.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strong hold, Mold it any way you want.
reviews.reviewText: I have this thing holding a Nuvi Garmin truck Nav, for anybody that doesn't know basically the size of an 8-in tablet and it's not light, proper quality on the dressed aluminum and suction cup legit grip. Aluminum tubing it's long enough for you to mold it onto anything, I'm using it for an f-450 and it's perfect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works great I drive for a living and it makes it easier to punch in information

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strong and rugged.
reviews.reviewText: Good quality. Built is strong, wont fall and looks will stay long. Nice product and design.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Helps place my Garmin where it can more easily be reached
reviews.reviewText: This has a good sturdy mount and while the arm is adjustable, it stays in place very well. I have one for my F-150 and one for my Nissan Murano, both of which have deep dashboards. I no longer have to stretch while entering addresses in from the built in keyboard display, and the Garmin stays in place while I do so since the arm is stiff enough to not move in the process. Very useful addition.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Almost the best GPS mount, except.....
reviews.reviewText: I bought this product along with the woleyi dual Ipad/cell phone mount back on May 6, 2023.I am pleased mostly with the window suction, which has never faltered in the 2 months since I purchased it.the arm constuction and positionality are great. However the mounting ball at the end of the arm where the GPS mounts to it is a very loose grip. the GPS will reposition at the slightest bump in the road. though the suction mount to the window and the arm are very secure, the whole thing is unsless because the GPS will not hold position. the only way I have managed to continue to use this mount is by placing the arm low on the window and utilizing the arm support that comes with the product. In this way I can position the arm just off the dashboard and rest the bottom of my GPS on the dash. This gets me by, however using the mount higher on the window will not allow my GPS to hold position. Maybe a bit more development is needed for this product, or just a positioning ball that fits would work best.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars R We there ?
reviews.reviewText: Just what is needed to keep an eye on your approaching location.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars it does fit standard Garmin mounting socket. I was wrong.
reviews.reviewText: This is by far the sturdiest and most rigid gooseneck mount I've ever come across and the added support piece is a great idea. However... the standard Garmin mount takes a 17mm ball and this has a 17.2mm ball.With all my strength I could not get it to fit as the opening of the socket is only 15.3mm that expands to accept the 17mm ball. Such a shame, I liked everything else about this product.I did find another straight neck mount that I was able to get to fit with a little "Impact Persuasion", but the neck on the APPS2 car mount was too long and flexible for me to get it in. If you have the strength, it will probably work fine. Like I said it seems like a superior mount. hope this helps.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product that allowed me to have a GPS again!
reviews.reviewText: This was a very useful product! The only recommendation I have is the secondary holder clip -put it as close to the GPS as possible to prevent wobbling/vibration.
Great product and quick delivery, needed it for a gps to be mounted, no issues with it. Definitely recommend.
I liked everything about the product, from start to finish.
Excellent produit, facile à installer et une bonne robustesse qui élimine vibrations du GPSbon produit, je le recommande.
